decks.notes: This combo-focused deck uses Painter's Servant and Grindstone as its primary win condition, aiming to mill opponents out quickly. It also includes several disruptive red cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to control the opponent's plays. The deck is built around generating mana quickly with cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide, allowing for a fast setup. The sideboard likely includes additional tools to handle different matchups effectively, optimizing the deck's performance in a Legacy 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Nadu, Winged Wisdom with Nomads en-Kor and Springheart Nantuko to generate infinite mana and card draw. It uses Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to tutor for combo pieces, while also running disruption in the form of Endurance, Collector Ouphe, and Sylvan Safekeeper. The deck aims to ramp quickly with mana dorks such as Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, while utilizing Gaea's Cradle to power out its win condition, Craterhoof Behemoth. The strategy emphasizes speed and consistency in executing the combo.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and cheating big creatures into play through cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By getting cards like Omniscience and The One Ring in play early, the deck can overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces. The goal is to quickly assemble a game-winning board state while disrupting opponents' strategies.

The key concept of this Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck is to efficiently control the opponent's board with disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck focuses on using card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right answers at the right time, supported by efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. Furthermore, the deck utilizes a mana denial strategy with Wasteland and aims to close out the game quickly with evasive threats like Murktide Regent.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Mystic Forge combo as quickly as possible using cards like Basalt Monolith, Voltaic Key, and Grim Monolith to generate mana. Once Mystic Forge is in play, the deck aims to use it in conjunction with artifacts like The One Ring and Glaring Fleshraker to create a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Defense Grid to protect its combo pieces and shut down opposing strategies.

The main goal of this deck is to control the game by using Stifle and Prismatic Ending to disrupt the opponent's plays, while also utilizing Consign to Memory, Daze, and Dress Down for further disruption. The deck aims to maintain control with counterspells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares, while also setting up card advantage with Brainstorm and Ponder. The win condition of the deck is to drop a Phyrexian Dreadnought, supported by Abhorrent Oculus, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Curie, Emergent Intelligence, to quickly finish off the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck with a focus on fetch lands and Wasteland for disruption.
